intro: Lappula sericata, commonly known as silver lappula, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as sorrel and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its delicate, hairy leaves and small, greenish flowers that appear in clusters. It typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in meadows and along riverbanks. Lappula sericata is an annual herb that plays a minor role in local ecosystems but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and distribution.
